importantDates.descriptionOfWhyDateIsRelevant: The date of the article's publication, indicating when the news event (the Eagles' victory over the Vikings) occurred and providing context for the current state of the NFL season.

importantTimeframes.descriptionOfWhyTimeFrameIsRelevant: The specific time the article was published, indicating the latest update on a live sports event and the timing of the game result.

keyTakeAways: Jalen Hurts delivered a standout performance, throwing for 326 yards and three touchdowns, including a 79-yard touchdown to DeVonta Smith and a 45-yard rainbow pass to A.J. Brown, helping the Eagles overcome a sluggish start.
The Eagles (5-2) rebounded from two straight losses by defeating the Minnesota Vikings (3-3) 28-22, with key contributions from A.J. Brown and DeVonta Smith.
Jalen Hunt returned an interception for a touchdown, adding a crucial score in the game.
The performance helped restore confidence in the Eagles’ offense, which had been dormant, and demonstrated Hurts’ status as a top-tier passer.
Carson Wentz struggled, going 26 for 42 for 313 yards, with two interceptions and poor red-zone execution, highlighting the contrast between the two quarterbacks.
The Eagles lost key players to injury, including Cam Jurgens (knee), Azeez Ojulari (hamstring), Jeremiah Trotter (ankle), and Adoree’ Jackson (concussion).
The game showcased effective offensive coordination, including a play-action fake and a well-timed fourth-down conversion by Hurts.
The Eagles’ next game is against the New York Giants, while the Vikings play the Los Angeles Chargers.

namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: Hurts was the main driving force behind the Eagles' victory, throwing for 326 yards and three touchdowns, and showcasing his Super Bowl MVP-level form.

namedEntities.name: DeVonta Smith
namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: Smith recorded a career-high 183 receiving yards and a 79-yard touchdown, playing a pivotal role in the Eagles’ offensive resurgence.

namedEntities.name: A.J. Brown
namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: Brown scored two touchdowns and was a key target for Hurts, helping revive the Eagles’ passing attack.

namedEntities.name: Carson Wentz
namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: Wentz struggled with the offense, throwing two interceptions and failing to perform well in the red zone, contrasting with Hurts’ success.

namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: Sirianni expressed confidence in Hurts and praised the team’s execution, particularly during fourth-down conversions and offensive coordination.

namedEntities.name: Kevin Patullo
namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: Patullo set up Hurts effectively, with well-timed calls that helped the Eagles gain 75 yards in 12 plays and convert key fourth-down situations.

summaryOfNewsArticle: The Philadelphia Eagles overcame a difficult start to the season by defeating the Minnesota Vikings 28-22 on Sunday, thanks to a stellar performance from quarterback Jalen Hurts. Hurts threw for 326 yards and three touchdowns, including a 79-yard catch by DeVonta Smith and a key 45-yard pass to A.J. Brown. Jalen Hunt also returned an interception for a score. The game marked a resurgence for the Eagles' struggling offense, which had been dormant prior. Carson Wentz struggled with interceptions and poor red-zone performance. The Eagles also lost several key players to injury, including center Cam Jurgens and defenders Azeez Ojulari and Jeremiah Trotter. The win improved the Eagles to 5-2, while the Vikings fell to 3-3. The Eagles are set to play the New York Giants next, while the Vikings face the Los Angeles Chargers.
title: Jalen Hurts Proves He’s a Top Passer with Spectacular Performance to Lead Eagles Over Vikings
